item.title: Matrix transpose with Prolog
item.description: Hello, an exam exercise requires me to write a matrix transpose method. I’ve written one and it took a little before I was able to define it completely in 4 rules. I’m curious then I’ve found this on stackoverflow: the approach is to calculate first transposed column, then shift by one column and calculate the transpose of that new matrix. This was one of the first solutions I’ve thought but I haven’t realized it because I’m too lazy to create a rule for calculating the shifted matrix.
